featured.text: For one thing, only the husk of the cactus is used for generating biofuel, while its inner flesh is still preserved for food.
It is reported that hip-hop fashion alone generates $750 million to $1 billion annually.
An estimated 2.5 million tons of carbon dioxide were generated in 2006 by the production of plastic for bottled water.
Exciting or challenging events __(39)__ the birth of a child, completion of a major project at work, or moving to a new city generate __(40)__ much stress as does tragedy or disaster.
Today, CGI (computer generated imagery) is widely used in filmmaking, and it is now 29 to create very lifelike scenes without using real stunt people.

other.text: In 2005, at least 55 million tons of apples were grown worldwide, which generated a value of about $10 billion.

definition.zh_def: 創造或產生某物，尤其是新的或原始的東西。
definition.en_def: To bring into existence; to produce or create something, especially something new or original.
definition.example: The artist will generate new ideas for her next exhibition.
